vlibtour.vlibtour_visit_emulation

Class VisitManagementMethodsHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • vlibtour.vlibtour_visit_emulation.VisitManagementMethodsHelper

  • public final class VisitManagementMethodsHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides utility methods for the visit of tourists. You are free to complement or modify this code. The data structures are designed to allow the management of the visit of several users. A limitation of the current implementation is that there is only one graph of positions. The limitation is imposed by the usage of the class GraphOfPositionsForEmulation.
    Author:
    Denis Conan

    • Method Detail

      • setVisit

        public static void setVisit(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> users,
                            java.util.List<Position> visit)
        sets the visit for a group of users. The visit is a set of Position; this is not a set in order to allow the visit of the same position several times in the same tour.
        Parameters:
        users - the group of users as a set.
        visit - the visit as a list of positions.

      • getVisit

        public static java.util.List<Position> getVisit(java.lang.String user)
        gets the visit of a user.
        Parameters:
        user - the identifier of the user
        Returns:
        the visit as a list of positions.

      • startVisit

        public static void startVisit(java.lang.String user)
        starts visiting, that is computes the path to the first POI.
        Parameters:

      • stepsInVisit

        public static void stepsInVisit(java.lang.String user)
        steps in the visit, that is computes the path to the next POI.
        Parameters:
        user - the identifier of the user.

      • isAtLastPOIOfTheVisit

        public static boolean isAtLastPOIOfTheVisit(java.lang.String user)
        states whether the given user has arrived to the last POI of the visit.
        Parameters:
        user - the identifier of the user.
        Returns:
        the boolean indicating whether the user is at the POI of the visit.
